info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central McDowell, southeastern Mitchell, southwestern Avery and southeastern Yancey Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burnsville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Burnsville, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Bandana, Ingalls, Woodlawn, North Cove and Micaville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
